. . . . . . . SVR5 based UnixWare

Last Updated: Thursday Oct 09, 1997 at 11:54:27 PDT

Welcome to Skunkware '97 for SVR5 based UnixWare

The following SCO Skunkware 97 components have been packaged for installation on the SVR5 based SCO UnixWare X.X (Gemini Beta) utilizing the pkgadd facility.

To install one of these packages, run the command (as root) : 

    # /usr/sbin/pkgadd -d <mount-point>/uw5/Packages/<package-name>.pkg all
where <package-name> refers to the NAME in the first column below and <mount-point> refers to the pathname of the CD-ROM mount point.

To install all of these components, or interactively choose which ones to install, run the command : 

    # <mount-point>/INSTALL


NAME		DESCRIPTION
====		===========

bzip            "bzip2, bunzip2 - a block-sorting file compressor"
elvis           "a clone of the ex/vi text editor"
maplay          "MPEG Audio Player"
mathrec         "Mathematical Recreations" (Pseudo-Visual only)
mesa            "Mesa GL 3-D Graphics Libraries"
timidity        "MIDI to WAVE converter and player"
vim             "Vi IMproved, a programmers text editor"
xanim           "multiformat animation/video/audio viewer for X"
xdir            "An Advanced Graphical FTP Client"
xmix            "X Windows (Xaw) interface to Open Sound System Sound Driver Mixer"
xpdf            "Portable  Document Format (PDF) file viewer for X"
xv              "Graphical file viewer & image manipulation for X" (shareware)
xwave           "Audio player, recorder, editor  for the X Window System"


In addition to the pkgadd installable components above, SCO Skunkware 97
contains several useful utilities and drivers which are manually installable.
These include :

/uw5/dist  -  
           A directory containing compressed tar and cpio archives.
           These can be installed as root by issuing the following commands:
           # cd /
           # gzcat /mnt/uw5/dist/foo.tar.gz | tar xvf -
           or
           # gzcat /mnt/uw5/dist/foo.cpio.gz | cpio -icdvu

/uw5/admin  - Contains the preview release of SCOadmin for Intranets

/uw5/audio  -  
            A directory containing maplay and timidity, an MPEG audio player
            and MIDI to WAV converter/player

/uw5/devtools  - Contains pre-built ready-to-install versions of
                 the GNU binutils and GNU make distributions

/uw5/editors  - Contains the elvis and vim editors

/uw5/net  - Contains LLNL xdir 2.0

/uw5/shellutil  - Contains both the UNIX and DOS bzip2 binary distributions

/uw5/x11/misc - Mathematical Recreations

/uw5/x11/viewers - xv, xanim, and xpdf



Finally, all of the packages and binary distributions for SCO UnixWare 2.x
seem to run just fine on the Gemini Beta release of SCO UnixWare X.X.
These are available in /uw2/Packages (see the file uw2/CONTENTS).
